path: ./Audit_Reports_2024/QuillAudits/Kichee Staking Smart Contract Audit Report - QuillAudits.pdf

findings.title: Centralization issue in staking contract
findings.description: In staking contract functions: setMinimum(), setMax(), setMultiplier(), setlockingTime(), SetPenaltyMultiplier(), setAPY(), setPenaltyPercentage(), setStakingHardCap(), setStakingLock() and withdrawTokensAdmin() are controlled by owner. More importantly losing private key in some situation can allow modifying and losing control over this important functionality and hacker can drain contract by calling withdrawTokensAdmin().
findings.function: setMinimum(), setMax(), setMultiplier(), setlockingTime(), SetPenaltyMultiplier(), setAPY(), setPenaltyPercentage(), setStakingHardCap(), setStakingLock() and withdrawTokensAdmin()

findings.title: Use of transferFrom() for withdrawal from contract
findings.description: In staking contract transferFrom() is used to withdraw tokens by admin.
